column4: again; can't mount CD drive/cd doesnt read disc. Tried all the howtos i can find,no luck.
again; can't mount CD drive/cd doesnt read disc. Tried all the howtos i can find,no luck.
the disc you are trying to mount, is it a dvd?, what does linux call your cd drive
it doesnt call it anything,i can√§t seem to mount it.
do you know what kind of hardware interface your cd drive uses pixie_?
i know that it's not a hardware issues though,reinstalled distro from cd a couple weeks back
okay pixie_ open up a console and type this: dmesg | grep CD Then tell us the output
yikes pixie_, you're kernel isn't finding your cd drive.  You aren't going to be able to do anything until it gets detected.
so how can i go about getting it to detect?
try finding out what type of cd drive you have and then we can help your kernel detect it pixie_
i'm really not a hacker. i'll just have to rad more howtos then. on how to find out what cd drive i use
thanks for the help anyways,i might be back later
we might be able to find out from here.  Is your drive internal or external?
what kind of computer is it?  Laptop, desktop...
laptop. Acer some years old something
